page.title: 06HUTTON HENRY 1985
page.content: Hutton Henry village is gradually changing with old houses modernised and recent private developments like Claypool Farm Close.Court Leet are two council houses built on the site of the old Manor Court.On the north side of the village are"The Acres", houses built in the 1930's with land for unemployed to earn a living.There are 2 churches in the village; St.Peter & St.Paul's Catholic Church is at the east end of the village & St.Francis Church is in the centre.The present Curch Hall,built in 1871, used to be the village school.The present school was built in 1964.The only pub is The Plough Inn and we have one general dealers cum Post Office.This year a Nursery Garden Centre was opened.Two houses have grazing rights on the common land in the village and we also have a village green and water pump.
